p: Different nanostructures were studied regarding their effects on plants and insects. Clay nanotubes used as carriers of pesticides showed extended release of substances, providing a better contact with minimum environmental effect [ 164]. Hydrophobic nanosilica is another example of such structures, which can be absorbed into the cuticle layer of insects upon contact, leading to their death [ 165]. Silica nanosphere formulations facilitate pesticides to enter the plant and reach the cell sap, exerting a systemic effect on insects such as aphids [ 166]. Moreover, these formulations alter the non-systemic behavior of pesticides and protect them from photodegradation [ 167].
